   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_except_no_ssa_opt_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 multiple_allocs/1,bs_get_tail/1,coverage/1,
   25:          binary_construction_allocation/1,unfold_literals/1]).
   26: 
   27: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   28: 
   29: all() ->
   30:     [{group,p}].
   31: 
   32: groups() ->
   33:     [{p,[parallel],
   34:       [multiple_allocs,
   35:        bs_get_tail,
   36:        coverage,
   37:        binary_construction_allocation,
   38:        unfold_literals]}].
   39: 
   40: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   41:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   42:     Config.
   43: 
   44: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   45:     ok.
   46: 
   47: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   48:     Config.
   49: 
   50: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: multiple_allocs(_Config) ->
   54:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,#{true:=[p]}},_}} =
   55: 	 (catch could(pda, 0.0, {false,true}, {p})),
   56:     {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,0},_}} = (catch place(lee)),
   57:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,wanted},_}} = (catch conditions()),
   58: 
   59:     ok.
   60: 
   61: could(_Coupons = pda, _Favorite = _pleasure = 0.0, {_, true}, {Presents}) ->
   62:     (0 = true) = #{true => [Presents]}.
   63: 
   64: place(lee) ->
   65:     (pregnancy = presentations) = [hours | [purchase || _ <- 0]] + wine.
   66: 
   67: conditions() ->
   68:     (talking = going) = storage + [large = wanted].
   69: 
   70: bs_get_tail(Config) ->
   71:     {<<"abc">>,0,0,Config} = bs_get_tail_1(id(<<0:32, "abc">>), 0, 0, Config),
   72:     {'EXIT',
   73:      {function_clause,
   74:       [{?MODULE,bs_get_tail_1,[<<>>,0,0,Config],_}|_]}} =
   75:         (catch bs_get_tail_1(id(<<>>), 0, 0, Config)),
   76: 
   77:     ok = bs_get_tail_2(<<"W">>, <<"X">>, <<"Z">>),
   78:     ok = bs_get_tail_2(<<"M">>, <<"X">>, <<"Z">>),
   79:     {'EXIT',
   80:      {function_clause,
   81:       [{?MODULE,do_get_bs_tail_2,[<<"A">>,<<"B">>,[],<<"C">>],_}|_]}} =
   82:         (catch bs_get_tail_2(<<"A">>, <<"B">>, <<"C">>)),
   83: 
   84:     ok.
   85: 
   86: bs_get_tail_1(<<_:32, Rest/binary>>, Z1, Z2, F1) ->
   87:     {Rest,Z1,Z2,F1}.
   88: 
   89: bs_get_tail_2(A, B, C) ->
   90:     do_get_bs_tail_2(A, B, [], C).
   91: 
   92: do_get_bs_tail_2(<<"W">>, <<"X">>, _, <<"Z">>) -> ok;
   93: do_get_bs_tail_2(<<"M">>, <<"X">>, _, <<"Z">>) -> ok.
   94: 
   95: coverage(_) ->
   96:     File = {file,"fake.erl"},
   97:     ok = fc(a),
   98:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,
   99: 	     [{?MODULE,fc,[[x]],[File,{line,2}]}|_]}} =
  100: 	(catch fc([x])),
  101:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,
  102: 	     [{?MODULE,fc,[y],[File,{line,2}]}|_]}} =
  103: 	(catch fc(y)),
  104:     case ?MODULE of
  105:         beam_except_no_opt_SUITE ->
  106:             %% There will be a different stack fram in
  107:             %% unoptimized code.
  108:             ok;
  109:         _ ->
  110:             {'EXIT',{function_clause,
  111:                      [{?MODULE,fc,[[a,b,c]],[File,{line,6}]}|_]}} =
  112:                 (catch fc([a,b,c]))
  113:     end,
  114: 
  115:     {'EXIT',{undef,[{erlang,error,[a,b,c,d],_}|_]}} =
  116: 	(catch erlang:error(a, b, c, d)),
  117: 
  118:     %% The stacktrace for operators such a '+' can vary depending on
  119:     %% whether the JIT is used or not.
  120:     case catch bar(x) of
  121:         {'EXIT',{badarith,[{erlang,'+',[x,1],[_|_]},
  122:                            {?MODULE,bar,1,[File,{line,9}]}|_]}} ->
  123:             ok;
  124:         {'EXIT',{badarith,[{?MODULE,bar,1,[File,{line,9}]}|_]}} ->
  125:             ok
  126:     end,
  127: 
  128:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,{1}},[{?MODULE,bar,1,[File,{line,9}]}|_]}} =
  129: 	(catch bar(0)),
  130: 
  131:     Self = self(),
  132:     {'EXIT',{{strange,Self},[{?MODULE,foo,[any],[File,{line,14}]}|_]}} =
  133:         (catch foo(any)),
  134: 
  135:     {ok,succeed,1,2} = foobar(succeed, 1, 2),
  136:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,[{?MODULE,foobar,[[fail],1,2],
  137:                                [{file,"fake.erl"},{line,16}]}|_]}} =
  138:         (catch foobar([fail], 1, 2)),
  139: 
  140:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,[{?MODULE,fake_function_clause1,[{a,b},42.0],_}|_]}} =
  141:         (catch fake_function_clause1({a,b})),
  142: 
  143:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,[{?MODULE,fake_function_clause2,[42|bad_tl],_}|_]}} =
  144:         (catch fake_function_clause2(42, bad_tl)),
  145: 
  146:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,[{?MODULE,fake_function_clause3,[x,y],_}|_]}} =
  147:         (catch fake_function_clause3(42, id([x,y]))),
  148: 
  149:     {'EXIT',{{function_clause,a,b,c}, _}} = catch fake_function_clause4(),
  150: 
  151:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,0.0},_}} = (catch coverage_1(id(42))),
  152:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = (catch coverage_1(id(a))),
  153: 
  154:     ok.
  155: 
  156: coverage_1(X) ->
  157:     %% ERL-1167: Would crash beam_except.
  158:     true = 0 / X.
  159: 
  160: fake_function_clause1(A) -> error(function_clause, [A,42.0]).
  161: 
  162: fake_function_clause2(A, Tl) -> error(function_clause, [A|Tl]).
  163: 
  164: fake_function_clause3(_, Stk) -> error(function_clause, Stk).
  165: 
  166: fake_function_clause4() -> error({function_clause,a,b,c}).
  167: 
  168: binary_construction_allocation(_Config) ->
  169:     ok = do_binary_construction_allocation("PUT"),
  170:     ok.
  171: 
  172: do_binary_construction_allocation(Req) ->
  173:     %% Allocation for building the error term was done by the
  174:     %% bs_init2 instruction. beam_except crashed because it expected
  175:     %% an explicit allocation instruction.
  176:     ok = case Req of
  177:              "POST" -> {error, <<"BAD METHOD ", Req/binary>>, Req};
  178:              _ -> ok
  179:          end.
  180: 
  181: unfold_literals(_Config) ->
  182:     a = do_unfold_literals(badarg, id({a,b})),
  183:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = catch do_unfold_literals(badarg, id(a)),
  184: 
  185:     ok.
  186: 
  187: do_unfold_literals(_BadArg, T) ->
  188:     %% The call `erlang:error(badarg)` in ?EXCEPTION_BLOCK would be
  189:     %% rewritten to `erlang:error(_BadArg)` by
  190:     %% beam_ssa_opt:unfold_literals/1, which would cause
  191:     %% beam_ssa_codegen:assert_exception_block/1 to fail.
  192:     element(1, T).
  193: 
  194: id(I) -> I.
  195: 
  196: -file("fake.erl", 1).
  197: fc(a) ->	                                %Line 2
  198:     ok;						%Line 3
  199: fc(L) when length(L) > 2 ->			%Line 4
  200:     %% Not the same as a "real" function_clause error.
  201:     error(function_clause, [L]).		%Line 6
  202: %% Would crash the compiler.
  203: bar(X) ->					%Line 8
  204:     case {X+1} of				%Line 9
  205: 	1 -> ok					%Line 10
  206:     end.					%Line 11
  207: %% Cover collection code for function_clause exceptions.
  208: foo(A) ->                                       %Line 13
  209:     error({strange,self()}, [A]).               %Line 14
  210: %% Cover beam_except:tag_literal/1.
  211: foobar(A, B, C) when is_atom(A) ->              %Line 16
  212:     {ok,A,B,C}.                                 %Line 17
